availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander C. Lindsay (hancock county, KY, farmer & home guard soldier)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Lindsay. Father of Charles Lindsay, Mary A. Lindsay, John Lindsay, Thomas P. Lindsay, Alexander C. Lindsay, Jr., Annie Lindsay, and Joe Lindsay. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Served in the Hancock County Home Guard in June 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 290A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 51.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 16.
KYR-0002-022-0048.
